576.$description: Extra small breakpoint (576px). For small mobile devices and narrow viewports.

768.$description: Small breakpoint (768px). For tablets and larger mobile devices in landscape.

1024.$description: Medium breakpoint (1024px). For small laptops and tablets in landscape.

1200.$description: Large breakpoint (1200px). For standard desktop displays.

1400.$description: Extra large breakpoint (1400px). For larger desktop displays.

1728.$description: Extra extra large breakpoint (1728px). For wide desktop displays and high-resolution monitors.

0_25x.$description: Negative spacing (-4px). Used for overlapping elements like the KdsAvatarGroup component.

none.$description: No spacing (0px). Use when no gap or padding is needed.

0_10x.$description: Micro spacing (1px). Use for minimal separation between tightly grouped elements.

0_12x.$description: Extra extra small spacing (2px). Use for very tight gaps between related elements.

0_25x.$description: Extra small spacing (4px). Use for tight gaps between closely related elements.

0_37x.$description: Small spacing (6px). Use for compact component internal padding.

0_5x.$description: Small-medium spacing (8px). Use for standard tight gaps and small component padding.

0_75x.$description: Medium-small spacing (12px). Use for moderate gaps between related elements.

1x.$description: Base spacing (16px). The standard spacing unit for most component padding and gaps.

1_25x.$description: Medium spacing (20px). Use for comfortable gaps between content sections.

1_5x.$description: Medium-large spacing (24px). Use for section padding and larger content gaps.

2x.$description: Large spacing (32px). Use for major section separation and container padding.

3x.$description: Extra large spacing (48px). Use for prominent section separation.

4x.$description: Extra extra large spacing (64px). Use for major layout divisions.

5x.$description: Maximum spacing (80px). Use for large layout gaps and page-level separation.

auto.$description: Auto spacing. Allows flexible distribution of space, typically used with flexbox layouts.

focus.$description: Focus ring offset (1px). Used by developers to set offset for focus border. Figma does not support offset.

0_25x.$description: Extra small component height (4px). Use for thin dividers and minimal height elements.

0_75x.$description: Small component height (12px). Use for compact inline elements and badges.

0_88x.$description: Small-medium component height (14px). Use for compact buttons and form elements.

1x.$description: Base component height (16px). Standard height for icons and small interactive elements.

1_25x.$description: Medium-small component height (20px). Use for small buttons and compact controls.

1_5x.$description: Medium component height (24px). Use for standard icons and small form elements.

1_75x.$description: Medium-large component height (28px). Use for small buttons and compact input fields.

2_25x.$description: Large component height (36px). Use for standard buttons and form inputs.

2_5x.$description: Large-extra component height (40px). Use for prominent buttons and larger inputs.

4x.$description: Extra large component height (64px). Use for large interactive elements and cards.

0_25x.$description: Extra small component width (4px). Use for thin dividers and minimal width elements.

0_75x.$description: Small component width (12px). Use for compact inline elements.

0_88x.$description: Small-medium component width (14px). Use for compact elements.

1x.$description: Base component width (16px). Standard width for icons and small elements.

1_25x.$description: Medium-small component width (20px). Use for small icons and compact controls.

1_5x.$description: Medium component width (24px). Use for standard icons.

1_75x.$description: Medium-large component width (28px). Use for larger icons and compact buttons.

2_25x.$description: Large component width (36px). Use for square buttons and larger icons.

4x.$description: Extra large component width (64px). Use for large interactive elements.

25x.$description: Container width (400px). Use for narrow sidepanels and modal widths.

32x.$description: Medium container width (512px). Use for standard sidepanels and dialogs.

45x.$description: Large container width (720px). Use for wide sidepanels and content areas.

61x.$description: Extra large container width (976px). Use for full-width content panels.

0_56x.$description: Extra small icon size (9px). Use for micro icons in compact contexts.

0_75x.$description: Small icon size (12px). Use for small icons in tight spaces and inline text.

1x.$description: Base icon size (16px). Standard icon size for most UI elements.

1_25x.$description: Large icon size (20px). Use for prominent icons and larger interactive elements.
